fullText: Barry Manilow and Bruce Sussman's musical about the Comedian Harmonists, a German singing group that was torn apart by the Nazis, is deeply sincere but dramatically inert.
bwwExcerpt: Theater sophisticates often take harmonizing for granted as a fundamental part of the craft, akin to learning lines. But to many Broadway audience members, it’s a rare pleasure and the vocal arrangements here (by Manilow and John O’Neill), come with an uncommon amount of theatricality — well, uncommon unless you are a longtime Manilow fan, given his decadeslong mastery of the kind of arrangements that bring anthems to a climax and people to their feet. The score will have its detractors, perhaps
